Class ArrayMethods

java.lang.Object
ArrayMethods
public class ArrayMethods extends Object
ArrayMethods(Methods for the array): 1) Create count() method. Count how much. 2) Create sum() method. Add them all up 3) Create average() method. Find the average. 4) Create findMax() method. Will find the max 5) Create findIndexofMax() method. Get the index of the max number from step 4. 6) Create findLast() method. Find the last occurance of the number 7) Create findAll() method. Find all the indices of the occurances. 8) Create getArray() method. Gets the array. 9) Create copyArray() method. Copies the array. 10) Create print() method. Copy and paste.
Since:
10/11/2023
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ethan Nguyen

    • count

      public int count()
      Count method. Counts how many numbers are in the array.
      Returns:
      count Returns the length of the array.

    • sum

      public int sum()
      Sum method. Adds up all the numbers in the array.
      Returns:
      total The sum of the numbers in the array

    • average

      public double average()
      Average method. Averages the amount in the array.
      Returns:
      avg The average of the numbers in the array.

    • findMax

      public int findMax()
      findMax method. Finds the max number in the array.
      Returns:
      max The max number.

    • findIndexOfMax

      public int findIndexOfMax()
      findIndexOfMax method. Finds the index of the max number from findMax method.
      Returns:
      maxIndex The index of the max number.

    • findLast

      public int findLast(int key)
      findLast method. Finds the last occurance of the number
      Parameters:
      key - The number we want to find the last occurance of
      Returns:
      last The last occurance of the number

    • findAll

      public int[] findAll(int key)
      findAll method. Finds the amount of times the number occurs and the index of the number.
      Parameters:
      key - The number we want to test for the amount of times it occurs
      Returns:
      amount An array with the amount of times the key occurs and the indices.
